intro: Rafnia angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leafed sycamore, is a member of the Moraceae family. It is a deciduous tree characterized by its slender, elongated leaves that are typically 5–10 cm in length. The tree produces small, clustered flowers that are followed by spherical, woody fruits containing a single seed. Its bark is smooth and light gray, becoming fissured with age. Rafnia angustifolia is native to parts of South America and is often found in moist, wooded areas.
